snippet: Ralph de la Vega, the chief executive of AT&T's wireless unit, says the company's new wireless home security system, Digital Life, would become available in March. And it plans major expansions for its fourth-generation LTE networks. He also has high...
abstract: Ralph de la Vega, the chief executive of AT&T's wireless unit, says the company's new wireless home security system, Digital Life, would become available in March. And it plans major expansions for its fourth-generation LTE networks. He also has high hopes for Windows phones.

headline.main: C.E.S. 2013: Ralph de la Vega of AT&T Mobility
